sen.j: 法華寺（ほっけじ）は、奈良県奈良市法華寺町にある光明宗の寺院。
sen.e: Hokke-ji Temple is a temple of Komyo sect in Hokkeji-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: @「光明宗」読み方不明ですが、光明皇后から「こうみょうしゅう」と推測しました。
sen.e: Hokke-ji Temple is a temple of Komyo sect in Hokkeji-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
Hokke-ji Temple is a temple of Komyo sect in Hokkeji-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 奈良時代には日本の総国分尼寺とされた。
sen.e: It was the so-kokubun-ni-ji Temple (the head nunnery temple) of Japan in the Nara period.
It was the so-kokubun-ni-ji Temple (the head nunnery temple) of Japan in the Nara period.
It was the so-kokubun-ni-ji Temple (the head nunnery temple) of Japan in the Nara period.

sen.j: 山号はなし。
sen.e: It has no sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple.
It has no sango (name of a group of Buddhist temples).
sen.cmt: 山号の説明を用語集にあわせるよう変更しました。
sen.e: It has no sango (name of a group of Buddhist temples).

sen.j: 本尊は十一面観音、開基は光明皇后である。
sen.e: Its principal image is Juichimen Kannon-zo (the statue of Eleven-faced Kannon) and its founder is Empress Komyo.
The principal image is Juichimen Kannon-zo (the statue of Eleven-faced Kannon) and the founder is Empress Komyo.
sen.cmt: founderのまえのitsをtheにしました。
sen.e: The principal image is Juichimen Kannon-zo (the statue of Eleven-faced Kannon) and the founder is Empress Komyo.

sen.j: 起源と歴史
sen.e: Origin and history
Origin and history
Origin and history

sen.j: 光明皇后ゆかりの寺として、また門跡尼寺（皇族などが住職となる格式高い寺院）として知られる。
sen.e: It is known as a monzeki temple (a prestigious temple whose chief priest is a member of the Imperial family etc.) as well as a temple associated with Empress Komyo,
It is known as a monzeki temple (a prestigious temple whose chief priest is a member of the Imperial family etc.) as well as a temple associated with Empress Komyo,
It is known as a monzeki temple (a prestigious temple whose chief priest is a member of the Imperial family etc.) as well as a temple associated with Empress Komyo,

sen.j: 東大寺が全国の総国分寺であったのに対し、法華寺は総国分尼寺であり、詳しくは法華滅罪之寺（ほっけめつざいのてら）といった。
sen.e: While Todai-ji Temple was the so-kokubun-ji Temple (head temple of Japan), Hokke-ji Temple was the so-kokubun-ni-ji Temple, and its exact name was Hokke metsuzai no tera.
While Todai-ji Temple was the so-kokubun-ji Temple (head temple of Japan), Hokke-ji Temple was the so-kokubun-ni-ji Temple, and its exact name was Hokke metsuzai no tera.
While Todai-ji Temple was the so-kokubun-ji Temple (head temple of Japan), Hokke-ji Temple was the so-kokubun-ni-ji Temple, and its exact name was Hokke metsuzai no tera.

sen.j: 法華寺の地にはもと藤原不比等の邸宅があり、不比等の没後、娘の光明子、すなわち光明皇后がこれを相続して皇后宮とした。
sen.e: At the place where Hokke-ji Temple is located now, there used to be a residence of Fujiwara no Fuhito, and after Fuhito died, his daughter Komyoshi, or Empress Komyo inherited it and used it as her residence.

At the place where Hokke-ji Temple is located now, there used to be a residence of Fujiwara no Fuhito, and after Fuhito died, his daughter Komyoshi, or Empress Komyo inherited it and used it as her residence.

At the place where Hokke-ji Temple is located now, there used to be a residence of Fujiwara no Fuhito, and after Fuhito died, his daughter Komyoshi, or Empress Komyo inherited it and used it as her residence.

sen.j: 天平17年（745年）皇后宮を宮寺としたのが法華寺の始まりである。
sen.e: In 745, the residence of Empress was made into gu-ji (temple associated with a shrine), which is the origin of Hokke-ji Temple.
In 745, the residence of Empress was made into gu-ji (temple associated with a shrine), which is the origin of Hokke-ji Temple.
In 745, the residence of Empress was made into gu-ji (temple associated with a shrine), which is the origin of Hokke-ji Temple.

sen.j: 大和国の国分尼寺、日本の総国分尼寺と位置付けられるのは、2年後の天平19年（747年）頃からである。
sen.e: It was around 747, two year after that, when ranked as the provincial nunnery of Yamato Province and the head nunnery of Japan.
It was around 747, two year after that, when the temple was ranked as the provincial nunnery of Yamato Province and the head nunnery of Japan.
sen.cmt: 意味を明確にするため、whenのあとにthe templeをいれました。
sen.e: It was around 747, two year after that, when the temple was ranked as the provincial nunnery of Yamato Province and the head nunnery of Japan.

sen.j: 法華寺造営のための役所であった造法華寺司は延暦元年（782年）に廃止されており、この頃には伽藍整備が完成していたと見られる。
sen.e: Office of Hokke-ji Temple Construction, which administrated errection of Hokke-ji Temple, was abolished in 782, so it is assumed that improvement of the temple was completed around that time.
Office of Hokke-ji Temple Construction, which administrated erection of Hokke-ji Temple, was abolished in 782, so it is assumed that the buildings of the temple was completed around that time.
sen.cmt: errectionのスペルミス。伽藍整備は寺の建物の建築という意味に変更しました。
sen.e: Office of Hokke-ji Temple Construction, which administrated erection of Hokke-ji Temple, was abolished in 782, so it is assumed that the buildings of the temple was completed around that time.

sen.j: 奈良時代の法華寺は東西両塔をもつ大寺院であったが、平安京遷都以後は次第に衰微し、平安時代末期にはかなり荒廃していたことが当時の記録から伺える。
sen.e: Hokke-ji Temple in the Nara period was a large temple with both east and west pagodas, but after the transfer of national capital to the city of Heian-kyo, it gradually declined and the record in the late Heian period shows that the temple almost came to ruin around that period.

Hokke-ji Temple in the Nara period was a large temple with both east and west pagodas, but after the transfer of the national capital to the city of Heian-kyo, it gradually declined and the record in the late Heian period shows that the temple almost came to ruin around that period.
sen.cmt: national capitalの前にtheを加えました。
sen.e: Hokke-ji Temple in the Nara period was a large temple with both east and west pagodas, but after the transfer of the national capital to the city of Heian-kyo, it gradually declined and the record in the late Heian period shows that the temple almost came to ruin around that period.

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）の平重衡の兵火では東大寺、興福寺が炎上し、法華寺も被害を受けたという。
sen.e: It is said that in 1180, Todai-ji temple and Kofuku-ji Temple went up in flames by the fire caused by the war of TAIRA no Shigehira, and Hokke-ji Temple was also damaged.
It is said that in 1180, Todai-ji temple and Kofuku-ji Temple went up in flames by the fire caused by the war of TAIRA no Shigehira, and Hokke-ji Temple was also damaged.
It is said that in 1180, Todai-ji temple and Kofuku-ji Temple went up in flames by the fire caused by the war of TAIRA no Shigehira, and Hokke-ji Temple was also damaged.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代に入り、東大寺大仏の再興を果たした僧・俊乗坊重源（しゅんじょうぼうちょうげん）は、建仁3年（1203年）、法華寺の堂宇や仏像を再興した。
sen.e: In the Kamakura period, a priest Chogen SHUNJOBO, who successfully restored the Great Buddha in Todai-ji Temple, restored temple buildings and Buddha statues of Hokke-ji Temple in 1203.
In the Kamakura period, a priest Chogen SHUNJOBO, who successfully restored the Great Buddha in Todai-ji Temple, restored temple buildings and Buddha statues of Hokke-ji Temple in 1203.
In the Kamakura period, a priest Chogen SHUNJOBO, who successfully restored the Great Buddha in Todai-ji Temple, restored temple buildings and Buddha statues of Hokke-ji Temple in 1203.

sen.j: 現在も寺に残る鎌倉時代様式の木造仏頭は、この再興時の本尊廬舎那仏（るしゃなぶつ）の頭部であると推定されている。
sen.e: The wooden Buddhist's head in Kamakura period style that remains in the Temple is assumed to be the head of Rushana Butsu, the principal image at the time of this restoration.
The wooden Buddhist's head in Kamakura period style that remains in the Temple is assumed to be the head of Rushana Butsu, the principal image at the time of this restoration.
The wooden Buddhist's head in Kamakura period style that remains in the Temple is assumed to be the head of Rushana Butsu, the principal image at the time of this restoration.

sen.j: さらに、鎌倉時代中期の真言律宗の僧・叡尊（えいそん）によって本格的な復興がなされた。
sen.e: Furthermore, Priest Eison, who belonged to Shingon Risshu sect in the mid Kamakura period, fully restore the temple.
Furthermore, Priest Eison, who belonged to Shingon Risshu sect in the mid Kamakura period, fully restored the temple.
Furthermore, Priest Eison, who belonged to Shingon Risshu sect in the mid Kamakura period, fully restored the temple.

sen.j: その後、明応8年（1499年）と永正3年（1506年）の兵火や慶長元年（1596年）の地震で東塔以外の建物を失った。
sen.e: After that, buildings except the east pagoda were lost by fires caused by wars in 1499 and 1506 and by an earthquak in 1596.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After that, buildings except the east pagoda were lost by fires caused by wars in 1499 and 1506 and by an earthquake in 1596.
After that, buildings except the east pagoda were lost by fires caused by wars in 1499 and 1506 and by an earthquake in 1596.

sen.j: 現在の本堂、鐘楼、南門は慶長6年（1601年）頃、豊臣秀頼と母の淀殿が片桐且元を奉行として復興したものである。
sen.e: Current hondo (main hall), shoro (bell tower), and nanmon (south gate) were restore by a bugyo (magistrate) Katsumoto KATAGIRI under the order of Hideyori TOYOTOMI and his mother Yodo-dono (Lady Yodo).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The current hondo (main hall), shoro (bell tower), and nanmon (south gate) were restored around 1601 by a bugyo (magistrate) Katsumoto KATAGIRI under the order of Hideyori TOYOTOMI and his mother Yodo-dono (Lady Yodo).
sen.cmt: Currentの前にtheを入れました。restoreをrestoredに変更しました。1601が訳漏れだったので、追加しました。
sen.e: The current hondo (main hall), shoro (bell tower), and nanmon (south gate) were restored around 1601 by a bugyo (magistrate) Katsumoto KATAGIRI under the order of Hideyori TOYOTOMI and his mother Yodo-dono (Lady Yodo).

sen.j: なお、兵火や地震の被害をまぬがれていた東塔は宝永4年（1707年）の地震で倒壊した。
sen.e: The east pagoda that survived fires and earthquake fell due to an earthquake in 1707.
The east pagoda that survived fires and earthquake fell due to an earthquake in 1707.
The east pagoda that survived fires and earthquake fell due to an earthquake in 1707.

sen.j: 法華寺は叡尊の時代以来、真言律宗における門跡寺院としての寺格を保っていたが、平成11年（1999年）、創建当時のように独立した寺に戻ることとなり、光明皇后にちなんで「光明宗」と名づけ離脱・独立した。
sen.e: Since the era of Eison, Hokke-ji temple had maintained its status as a monzeki temple of Shingon Risshu sect, but in 1999, it decided to return to an independent temple as it was at the time of foundation, and named itself 'Komyo sect after' Empress Komyo to secede and separate.

Since the era of Eison, Hokke-ji temple had maintained its status as a monzeki temple of Shingon Risshu sect, but in 1999, it decided to return to an independent temple as it was at the time of foundation, and named itself 'Komyo sect' after Empress Komyo to secede and separate.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションをafterの前に移動しました。
sen.e: Since the era of Eison, Hokke-ji temple had maintained its status as a monzeki temple of Shingon Risshu sect, but in 1999, it decided to return to an independent temple as it was at the time of foundation, and named itself 'Komyo sect' after Empress Komyo to secede and separate.

sen.j: 伽藍
sen.e: Temples
Buildings of the temple
sen.cmt: 寺の建物という意味に修正しました。
sen.e: Buildings of the temple

sen.j: 本堂（重要文化財）－慶長6年（1601年）、豊臣秀頼と淀殿の寄進で再建された。
sen.e: Hondo (Important Cultural Property) - Restored by donation from Hideyori Toyotomi and Yodo-dono in 1601.
Hondo (Important Cultural Property) - Restored by donation from Hideyori TOYOTOMI and Yodo-dono in 1601.
sen.cmt: Hondoの後のスペースを削除しました。Toyotomiを大文字にする。
sen.e: Hondo (Important Cultural Property) - Restored by donation from Hideyori TOYOTOMI and Yodo-dono in 1601.

sen.j: 寄棟造、本瓦葺き。
sen.e: Yosemune-zukuri (hipped roof) style, with formal tiles.
Yosemune-zukuri (hipped roof) style, with formal tiles.
Yosemune-zukuri (hipped roof) style, with formal tiles.

sen.j: 再建にあたっては、地震で倒れた前身堂の部材が再利用されている。
sen.e: Material of the former main hall that had been destroyed by the earthquake was resued to restore the hall.
Materials of the former main hall that had been destroyed by the earthquake was reused to restore the hall.
sen.cmt: Materialを複数にしました。また、resued はスペルミス。
sen.e: Materials of the former main hall that had been destroyed by the earthquake was reused to restore the hall.

sen.j: 堂内厨子に本尊十一面観音像を安置する。
sen.e: The principal image Juichimen Kannon-zo is enshrined in the zushi (a cupboard-like case with double doors) in the hall.
The principal image, Juichimen Kannon-zo, is enshrined in the zushi (a cupboard-like case with double doors) in the hall.
sen.cmt: Juichimen Kannon-zoの前後にコンマを追加しました。
sen.e: The principal image, Juichimen Kannon-zo, is enshrined in the zushi (a cupboard-like case with double doors) in the hall.

sen.j: 鐘楼（重要文化財）－鬼瓦に慶長6年（1601年）の刻銘があり、鐘楼の形式や細部からみて桃山時代の再興と考えられる。
sen.e: Shoro (Important Cultural Property) - There is an inscription of 1601 on the Onigawara (Japanese gargoyle roof tile), and based on the style and detail of shoro, it is assumed to be restored in the Momoyama period.

Shoro (Important Cultural Property) - There is an inscription of 1601 on the Onigawara (Japanese gargoyle roof tile), and based on the style and detail of shoro, it is assumed to be restored in the Momoyama period.

Shoro (Important Cultural Property) - There is an inscription of 1601 on the Onigawara (Japanese gargoyle roof tile), and based on the style and detail of shoro, it is assumed to be restored in the Momoyama period.

sen.j: 南門（重要文化財）－切妻造・本瓦葺の四脚門で、本堂と同時に再建された。
sen.e: Nanmon (Important Cultural Property) - A four-legged gate with a gable roof with formal tiles that was restored when hondo was restored.
Nanmon (Important Cultural Property) - A four-legged gate with a gable roof with formal tiles that was restored when the hondo was restored.
sen.cmt: a gableの前のスペースを削除しました。またhondoの前にtheを入れました。

sen.j: 赤門
sen.e: Akamon (red gate)
Akamon (red gate)

sen.j: 客殿－本堂裏手にある書院造建築。
sen.e: Kyakuden (guest hall) - A shoin-zukuri style (a traditional Japanese style of residential architecture that includes a tokonoma) building behind the hondo.
Kyakuden (guest hall) - A shoin-zukuri style (a traditional Japanese style of residential architecture that includes a tokonoma) building behind the hondo.

sen.j: 庭園は国の名勝に指定されている。
sen.e: Its garden is designated as a national place of scenic beauty.
Its garden is designated as a national scenic beauty.
sen.cmt: place of を削除しました。
sen.e: Its garden is designated as a national scenic beauty.

sen.j: から風呂（重要有形民俗文化財）－光明皇后が千人の垢を自ら流したという伝説のある蒸し風呂であるが、現存の建物は江戸時代中期以降のものである。
sen.e: Steam bath (significant tangible folk cultural asset) - A steam bath that has a legend that Empress Komyo herself washed grime of one thousand people, but the current building was built after the mid Edo period.

Steam bath (significant tangible folk cultural asset) - A steam bath that has a legend that Empress Komyo herself washed grime of one thousand people, but the current building was built after the mid Edo period.

sen.j: 横笛堂－かつて南門を出て左側の飛地境内にあったが、赤門の東側に移築されている。
sen.e: Yokobue-do Hall - It used to be located at the detached territory on the left of outside of Akamon, but it was moved to the east side of Akamon.
Yokobue-do Hall - It used to be located at the detached temple grounds on the left of outside of Akamon, but it was moved to the east side of Akamon.
sen.cmt: Its territoryをthe temple groundsに変更しました。
sen.e: Yokobue-do Hall - It used to be located at the detached temple grounds on the left of outside of Akamon, but it was moved to the east side of Akamon.

sen.j: 『平家物語』や高山樗牛の「滝口入道」で知られる悲恋物語のヒロイン・横笛が尼となった後に住んだとされる建物。
sen.e: They say that Yokobue, the heroine of the tale of tragic love known by "The Tale of the Heike" and 'Nyudo TAKIGUCHI' by Chogyu TAKAYAMA, lived in this building after becoming a nun.
They say that Yokobue, the heroine of the tale of tragic love known by "The Tale of the Heike" and 'Nyudo TAKIGUCHI' by Chogyu TAKAYAMA, lived in this building after becoming a nun.
They say that Yokobue, the heroine of the tale of tragic love known by "The Tale of the Heike" and 'Nyudo TAKIGUCHI' by Chogyu TAKAYAMA, lived in this building after becoming a nun.

sen.j: 横笛が手紙の反故（ほご）で自らの姿を作ったという伝承のある張り子の横笛像（高さ約30センチ）が安置されていたが、本堂に移されている。
sen.e: There is a lore that Yokobue created her own shape using waste letter paper, and the papier-mache statue of Yokobue (about 30-centimeters high) used to be enshrined here, but it was moved to hondo.

There is a lore that Yokobue created her own shape using waste letter paper, and the papier-mache statue of Yokobue (about 30-centimeters high) used to be enshrined here, but it was moved to the hondo.

sen.j: 国宝
sen.e: National Treasures
National Treasures

sen.j: 木造十一面観音立像－法華寺の本尊。
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of eleven-faced Kannon (Goddess of Mercy) - The principal image of Hokke-ji Temple.
Wooden standing statue of eleven-faced Kannon (Goddess of Mercy) - The principal image of Hokke-ji Temple.

sen.j: 像高約1メートルの比較的小さな像である。
sen.e: It is a relatively small statue whose height is about one meter.
It is a relatively small statue whose height is about one meter.
It is a relatively small statue whose height is about one meter.

sen.j: 「天竺（インド）の仏師・問答師が光明皇后の姿を模してつくった」という伝承をもつが、実際の制作は平安時代前期と見られる。
sen.e: There is a lore that an Indian sculptor Mondoshi created it modeling after Empress Komyo, but actual period of creation is assumed to be early Heian period.
There is a lore that an Indian sculptor Mondoshi created it modeling after Empress Komyo, but actual period of creation is assumed to be the early Heian period.
There is a lore that an Indian sculptor Mondoshi created it modeling after Empress Komyo, but actual period of creation is assumed to be the early Heian period.

sen.j: 制作当初から彩色や金箔を施していない素木像だった。
sen.e: Since the time of creation, it was a plane wood statue without coloring or gold leaf.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since the time of creation, it was a plane wood statue without coloring or gold leaf.
Since the time of creation, it was a plane wood statue without coloring or gold leaf.

sen.j: 髪、瞳、眉などに黒、唇に朱を塗り、髪や装身具の一部に金属を用いるほかは、木肌の美しさを生かした素地仕上げとする。
sen.e: Except that its hair, pupils, and eyebrows etc. were painted black and the lips were painted red, and metal was used in some part of hair and accesaries, it is finished with beautiful wood surface.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Except that its hair, pupils, and eyebrows etc. were painted black and the lips were painted red, and metal was used in some part of hair and accessories, it is finished with beautiful wood surface.
Except that its hair, pupils, and eyebrows etc. were painted black and the lips were painted red, and metal was used in some part of hair and accessories, it is finished with beautiful wood surface.

sen.j: 両手首から先など、ごく一部を別材とするほか、頭・体の主要部を一材から彫り出した一木造である。
sen.e: Except for small portions including its hands that are created using different materials, it is Ichiboku-zukuri, whose major parts of the head and body are carved of one tree.
Except for small portions including its hands that are created using different materials, it is Ichiboku-zukuri, whose major parts of the head and body are carved of one tree.
Except for small portions including its hands that are created using different materials, it is Ichiboku-zukuri, whose major parts of the head and body are carved of one tree.

sen.j: 本像の風貌や全体のプロポーションにはどこか女性的・異国的なものを感じさせることから、前述のような伝承を生んだものであろう。
sen.e: It is supposed that the above mentioned lore was created because the appearance and overall figure of this statue have somehow feminine and exotic feeling.
It is supposed that the above mentioned lore was created because the appearance and overall figure of this statue have somehow feminine and exotic feeling.
It is supposed that the above mentioned lore was created because the appearance and overall figure of this statue have somehow feminine and exotic feeling.

sen.j: 保存状態もよく、平安時代彫刻を代表する作品の1つである。
sen.e: It is well-preserved and it is a work that represents the sculptures in the Heian perid.
It is well-preserved and it is a work that represents the sculptures in the Heian period.
It is well-preserved and it is a work that represents the sculptures in the Heian period.

sen.j: 当初からの本尊ではなく、近世初頭に本堂が再興された際に本尊とされたものと考えられている。
sen.e: It is assumed that it was not the original principal image, but it was made to be the principal image when the hondo was restored early in the modern time.
It is assumed that it was not the original principal image, but it was made to be the principal image when the hondo was restored in the early modern time.
sen.cmt: earlyをmodernの前に移動しました。
sen.e: It is assumed that it was not the original principal image, but it was made to be the principal image when the hondo was restored in the early modern time.

sen.j: 絹本着色阿弥陀三尊及び童子像－平安時代末～鎌倉時代初期の仏画。

Kempon chakushoku Amida Sanzon and doji zo (the colored images of Amida Triad and children on silk) - A Buddhist painting from the late Heian period to the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: earlyの前にtheを入れました。ChildsをChildrenに変更しました。

sen.j: § から浴室（からふろ）施浴法要
sen.e: Steam bath bathing memorial service
sen.cmt: 記号§は訳文では削除しました。
sen.e: Steam bath bathing memorial service
Steam bath bathing memorial service

sen.j: 法華寺浴室は光明皇后様御発願以来一貫して一般庶民のために施浴施設として活用され続け、薬草を用いて蒸し風呂を炊くという、極めて珍しい形式の浴室です。
sen.e: The bathroom of Hokke-ji Temple has been consistently utilized by common people as a bathing facility since its erection at the wish of the Empress Komyo, which has a very rare style of heatin the bath using medical herbs.

The bathroom of Hokke-ji Temple has been consistently utilized by common people as a bathing facility since its erection at the wish of the Empress Komyo, which has a very rare style of the steam bath using medical herbs.
sen.cmt: より自然な表現になるように、薬草を用いた蒸し風呂の表現を変更しました。
sen.e: The bathroom of Hokke-ji Temple has been consistently utilized by common people as a bathing facility since its erection at the wish of the Empress Komyo, which has a very rare style of the steam bath using medical herbs.

sen.j: また、近年に古式に則り竃を炊いて、沐浴修行する施浴法要を復活しました。
sen.e: Recently, bathing memorial event for ascetic practices of balneum bath by heating a furnace in accordance with ancient ritual was restored.
Recently, bathing memorial event for ascetic practices of balneum bath by heating a furnace in accordance with ancient ritual was restored.
Recently, bathing memorial event for ascetic practices of balneum bath by heating a furnace in accordance with ancient ritual was restored.

sen.j: 施浴法要実施日 6月13日 （体験は信徒会員対象、入会は法華寺宛て問合せ下さい。）
sen.e: Date of bathing memorial service: June 13 (Open to support members only. For membership, please contact Hokke-ji Temple).
Date of bathing memorial service: June 13 (Open to support members only. For membership, please contact Hokke-ji Temple).
Date of bathing memorial service: June 13 (Open to support members only. For membership, please contact Hokke-ji Temple).

sen.j: 法華寺蓮を愛で、象鼻盃をいただき、お寺で癒しのひと時を過ごしていただけます。
sen.e: You can enjoy lotus flowers in Hokke-ji Temple, drink with Zobihai, and a healing time in the temple.
